body:
1. I suggest you take the time to add this information to the documentation.
2. The change in the vendor code is not just to identify the `form_tag`
issue.  It's to produce consistent behavior in an HTML::Document.

On Thu, Oct 11, 2012 at 8:39 AM, Rafael Mendonça França <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I confirmed with the Rails Core team and the form_tag without block
> should not generate the closing tag. This is intentional and documented.
> The documentation says that it starts the form tag and the block version is
> an exception to this behavior.
>
> This is similar with File.open that closes the file if you pass a block,
> but not close it without the block.
>
> Also I discussed about the change in the vendor code and they said that we
> don't need to accept it because the change is to identify the form_tagpossible issue.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/7901#issuecomment-9338215>.
>
>
